description.item: This report includes important security information about your web application.

item.name: Missing Secure Attribute in Encrypted Session (SSL) Cookie
Weak Cipher Suites - ROBOT Attack : Vulnerable cipher suites are supported by the server
Weak Ciphers are detected: Not all cipher suites support Perfect Forward Secrecy
Cookie with Insecure or Improper or Missing SameSite attribute
Unnecessary Http Response Headers found in the Application
Web Application Source Code Disclosure Pattern Found

item.reasoning: AppScan found a link to an external site, and was not able to resolve it

cause-group.item: The web application contains a link to a non-existing domain
The web application sends non-secure cookies over SSL

Cipher Suites that support TLS-RSA key exchange were detected. The web server or application server with TLS implementation flaw may be vulnerable to ROBOT Attack. This issue does not necessarily mean that you are vulnerable. Please follow the advisory guideline.
The web server or application server are configured in an insecure way
Sensitive information might have been cached by your browser
There is no support to Subresource Integrity.
Sensitive Cookie with Improper or Insecure or Missing SameSite Attribute
Insecure web application programming or configuration
The rel attribute in the link element is not set to "noopener noreferrer".
Latest patches or hotfixes for 3rd. party products were not installed
Temporary files were left in production environment
Debugging information was left by the programmer in web pages
Proper bounds checking were not performed on incoming parameter values
No validation was done in order to make sure that user input matches the data type expected
Cookies are created at the client side

An Integer Overflow (or wraparound) occurs when a value that is too large is stored (larger than the maximum value the variable can hold) in an integer data type (including byte, short, long, and other types). The most significant bits of the integer are lost, and the remaining value is relative to the minimum value (either 0 or very negative value for signed types).

security-risk-group.item: It is possible to persuade a naive user to supply sensitive information such as username, password, credit card number, social security number etc.
It may be possible to steal user and session information (cookies) that was sent during an encrypted session

It may be possible to steal or manipulate customer session and cookies, which might be used to impersonate a legitimate user, allowing the hacker to view or alter user records, and to perform transactions as that user
It is possible to gather sensitive information about the web application such as usernames, passwords, machine name and/or sensitive file locations
In case the third-party server is compromised, the content/behavior of the site will change

Prevent cookie information leakage by restricting cookies to first-party or same-site context, Attacks can extend to Cross-Site-Request-Forgery (CSRF) attacks if there are no additional protections in place (such as Anti-CSRF tokens).
It is possible to retrieve information about the site's file system structure, which may help the attacker to map the web site
It is possible to retrieve the source code of server-side scripts, which may expose the application logic and other sensitive information such as usernames and passwords
It is possible to gather sensitive debugging information
The worst case scenario for this attack depends on the context and role of the cookies that are created at the client side

item.name: Remove the non-existing domain from the web site
Add the 'Secure' attribute to all sensitive cookies
Add the attribute rel = "noopener noreferrer" to each link element with target="_blank"
Add to each third-party script/link element support to SRI(Subresource Integrity).
Config your server to use the "Content-Security-Policy" header with secure policies
Config your server to use the "Referrer Policy" header with secure policies
Do not allow sensitive information to leak.
Issue a "404 - Not Found" response status code for a forbidden resource, or remove it completely
Prevent caching of SSL pages by adding "Cache-Control: no-store" and "Pragma: no-cache" headers to their responses.
Remove business and security logic from the client side
Remove e-mail addresses from the website
Remove internal IP addresses from your website
Remove source code files from your web-server and apply any relevant patches
Review possible solutions for configuring SameSite Cookie attribute to recommended values
Verify that parameter values are in their expected ranges and types. Do not output debugging error messages and exceptions
